Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2001, Dawn Rees was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Dawn was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020120.CaseDesc: On October 19th 2003, Jeanne-D'Arc Asselin, 66, was to go to her boyfriend's but called to cancel at the last minute. Ms Asselin went to buy beer at the convenience store and was never seen again. She disappeared from Valleyfield. During the months prior to her disappearance, she seemed confused and had memory loss. Ms Asselin had suffered a stroke in the past.

Case reference: 2014006285.CaseDesc: Philippe Guerin was reported missing from the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital on June 12, 1966. He is paralyzed on the left side as a result of having Polio at 10 years of age. He is missing his upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014002728.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1996, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Gary Landry was last seen as he left his residence in Thunder Bay, Ontario, on his dark blue 12 speed Supercycle Mountain bike with black plastic fenders. Gary was prone to having seizures and frequented the north side of Thunder Bay on his bicycle.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2016067449.CaseDesc: Jennifer Hillier-Penney was last seen in St. Anthony, NL on November 30, 2016.  It is believed that she went missing around 8:00 pm that evening from a residence in that community. Her personal belongings, including her cell phone, purse, shoes and jacket were left behind.

Tattoo: Capricorn sign on wrist, unsure of which wrist
Right Chest, eye of horus on the right rib
Scar: on knee from surgery, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2014004748.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2006, Diana “Daya” Gregory was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. On that day, Diana had planned to visit her sister, but did not show up. She is known to use the Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) when she travelled within the city, and resided in the downtown core.

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2014003793.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1980, Keith Dufour was seen for the last time at his residence in the town of Amherstburg, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Forehead, Right temple on the forehead

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006013099.CaseDesc: On June 22, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near Petrie Island, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020167.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet. He was previously discovered as a stowaway on the vessel S.K. Junior that originated in Nigbo, China on March 15th, 1997 and arrived in Vancouver April 4th, 1997.

Teeth: Stained, Poor oral hygiene and forensic analysis identified many unique characteristics in his dentition.
Jacket: Synthetic, Blue, Red, blue and white track suit jacket with stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2014001755.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1982, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Howard Dobie was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Montreal, Quebec. Howard had left without saying where he was going. At the time of his disappearance, Howard was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Mr. Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow. When he failed to return three days later he was reported missing to police by a friend. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, Mr. Hopkins' boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Numerous personal items were found on shore around the boat. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Mr. Hopkins has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that Mr. Hopkins drowned.

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 2017014435.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2009, an unidentified man died of lung cancer in the Foothills Hospital in Calgary, Alberta. It was later discovered that this individual had presented false identification at the hospital and was buried under the same incorrect name. At the time of his death this man had a black mustache. There were no teeth present and this individual had upper and lower dentures.

Jewelry: Metal, White, EARRING, White metal with a clear stone
Tattoo: Right Hip, Naked woman intertwined with dragon down thigh

Case reference: 2016053812.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2016, at approximately 2:30 a.m., Van Pham was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003512.CaseDesc: In early October, 1992, Darlene Shallow was seen for the last time between Danforth Street and Midland Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2014004569.CaseDesc: In August 1966, Philomene (Tiger) Lemay was socializing at a local bar in Slave Lake.  She was last seen very intoxicated.  Mrs. Lemay may have left with one or two men, possibly Americans, in the early evening.

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020652.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1995, at 3:38 p.m. this unknown male was the victim of a train accident. He may have been in Kamloops, BC, at Padova City Resorts Inc., as he was in possession of one of their T-shirts. His travelling partner stated that the unknown male had said his name was Brian and he was from Ontario. The unknown male was very conscious of his personal hygiene as he always wanted to be clean shaven and neat in his appearance.

Shirt: Grey, T-shirt underneath the blue shirt
Mark: Abdomen, May have been heavy at one time as stretch type marks

Case reference: 2010001799.CaseDesc: On the morning of May 18, 1993, Christine Harron stayed home from school as she was not feeling well. Around lunch time Christine and her mother argued about Christine returning to school for the afternoon. Her mother heard Christine leave the house at about 1:30 pm. Christine did not attend school that afternoon and she has not been seen since. The investigation revealed that Christine left the house without her purse, money or knapsack. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Christine Harron, however her remains have yet to be located.

Glasses: Plastic, Brown, Large rimmed with tape

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New-Brunswick to meet someone in the City of Moncton, New-Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018041669.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2003, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Yunerkis Cervantes-Estrada was seen for the last time at her residence in Toronto, Ontario. On the following day, Yunerkis left a note at her house which indicated that she was going to a party.

Case reference: 2020008550.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1984, Anita Tamboom was seen for the last time by her neighbour in Toronto, Ontario. Anita was known to frequently leave her home for extended periods, but she would always return. During the time of her disappearance, Anita was suffering from some mental health issues, and her purse was located on the shores of Lake Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004406.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1973, Caroline Burns was last seen in the early morning leaving her residence in Molanosa, SK. Molanosa is a small isolated community approximately 70 kilometers south of La Ronge, SK. Extensive searches of the area at the time failed to reveal any trace of Ms. Burns.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing left top molar and left front tooth
Mark: Right Knee, Burn mark on side of either left or right knee

Case reference: 2014005893.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2012, Timothy Colbon was seen for the last time as he left a residence, without wearing any shoes, in Elk Lake, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Timothy had travelled with friends from London, Ontario to Elk Lake.

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011670.CaseDesc: On June 8, 1998, the body of a male was spotted by boaters on the St. Lawrence River, at St-Donat near Bellerive Park. According to the autopsy, the man may have made previous suicide attempts. He was found to be dressed in light clothing, suggesting his death may go back to the heat wave during the month of May 1998.

Socks: Grey, One sock on the right foot.
Bathing Suit: Nylon, Blue, Boxer type swim suit,  "Surf King Majestic" Brand, size XL
Scar: Abdomen, Vertical scar near the belly button.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (nee Tyo) was last seen on the morning of July 25, 2008  walking away from the Lincoln Motor Inn on McPhillips Street.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, bottom 12" dyed blonde

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2016065869.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1976, the decomposed remains of a male individual were recovered from the water in Port Arthur Marina in the Thunder Bay Harbour. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His pockets contained a red handkerchief, pipe for smoking, book of matches and a broken pencil. It is believed that he had been in the water since the fall of 1975.

Hair: Brown, receding hairline and a moustache
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Brass ring with a silver finish on the small finger of his left hand
Scar: Right Abdomen, Long wide scar on his upper abdominal region

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2014005064.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1983, Roy Nippi was last seen on the Chagoness/Kinistin First Nation near Tisdale, Saskatchewan. Roy was known to travel throughout western Canada and the western USA, however, searches and inquiries over the years with contacts in those provinces and states have failed to reveal any trace of Roy.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2016068138.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, a male was recovered from the Detroit River near Cooper's Marina in the township of Anderdon, County Essex, 5 km north of Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 190-200lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has no obvious scars or tattoos and is uncircumcised. Police believe that this individual is American, based on the clothing labels. It is thought that he had been in the water for as long as two months.

Hair: Black, A small amount of hair was also present on his chin.
Teeth: Most of his teeth are present and there are several amalgam (silver) restorations.
Belt: Leather, Brown, with rivets and a pattern on the leather
Shirt: Gold, Hudson Sport Detroit, short-sleeved  sport shirt with three buttons at the neck
Sweater: Gold, Arnold Palmer Design USA, cardigan
Jacket: Beige, St. John's Bay, hooded with a zipper in front; made in Korea
Hat: Wool, Red, Brown, woolen toque in his pocket

Case reference: 2015044121.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1972, Allen Robert Foy was seen for the last time leaving his home in the Saint-Hubert district of Longueuil, Quebec. Allen Robert said he was travelling on vacation north in the Laurentians to go fishing. He left in his vehicle, a green 1970’s Chrysler Newport which was found 4 or 5 years later, near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonneville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003688.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1981, William Earnshaw was hunting in the Clemenceau District, SK, southwest of Hudson Bay, SK. He had separated from two companions and failed to meet at their vehicle in the evening. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Earnshaw.

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017075870.CaseDesc: Andrew Jutte was last seen around September 20, 2017, in the downtown core of Vancouver, British-Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry LEGACY was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2001008160.CaseDesc: Jesokah was last seen at approximately 21:30 hours as she was going to take a bus back to the village of Sooke.

Case reference: 2016068706.CaseDesc: On June 19, 1967, an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 35 to 50 years old, was found in the water chute at the rear of 115 Cameron Avenue in Dundas. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was found naked. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for 3 to 4 weeks.

Teeth: Visible Missing, A single amalgam filling is noted, as well as, an unerrupted 2nd molar. Many teeth of the lower jaw missing.

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2014003568.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1998, Todd Russell Fraser was seen for the last time in the Fairview district in Vancouver, British Columbia. All his belongings were found in his apartment. Todd has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2016061146.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1964, the body of what was described as a young male was recovered from Lake Erie, off the tip of Long Point, adjacent to the Township of South Walsingham, County Norfolk. His post-mortem weight was recorded at approximately 190 lbs. Due to decompositional changes and post-mortem injury, this may not be an accurate reflection of his living weight. His appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a minimum of 3 months.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in some of his molars and a gold inlay in his lower right 2nd molar.
Bathing Suit: Brown, Tan, trunks with a black/dark blue stripe on each side (34" waist)

Case reference: 2016065655.CaseDesc:
On May 27, 1978, a female was found floating 1000 feet off the west shore of Fighting Island, Sandwich West Township in the Detroit River. 
Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 155lbs, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
It is estimated that she had been in the water for a couple of days to a couple of weeks.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations and is missing her upper left canine tooth
Blouse: Multi-coloured long-sleeved button front, floral & green square pattern "Lennington California"Brand
Socks: Cotton, Multi-coloured red and yellow elasticized cotton ankle socks
Other: Intrauterine device implanted in her uterus.

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black
Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2016059266.CaseDesc:
On March 29th, 2008, the body of a male was found under a subway bridge at Bloor and Parliament Streets, Toronto, where he apparently slept often. A beige jacket, black nylon pants, a dark blue knit hat and tan ankle shoes with tan laces were located in close proximity to his body.  He was uncircumcised and his appendix is absent.
He is believed to be a homeless individual and was found by another homeless man who referred to him as "Pops" and "Joe".

Hair: Brown, Grey, Wavy, Short, Beard & moustache, slightly greying & yellow
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost prior to his death and the remaining teeth are decayed. There is no dental work.
Underwear: Dark Blue, White, Dark blue/black and white striped boxers
Pants: Checkered black and blue flannel pants
Deformity: Valgus deformity of both large toes
Fractured/Broken Bones: Pelvis, Healed fracture, left Ilio-pubic ramus
Scar: 1.5 cm in length, inner right knee
Right Abdomen, 16 cm scar with suture marks
a 6 cm scar on his right lower abdomen

Case reference: 2006008499.CaseDesc: Anthony Huss was last seen November 08, 1975 leaving the Bon Aire Motel. He indicated that he was travelling to Chapleau. His vehicle was located, abandoned in a bush area near Smokey Falls, Kipling Township, District of Cochrane. Mr. Huss has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006012499.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the skeletal remains of a male was found along the north bank of St. Mary's River in Bell's Point Park, Garden River First Nation, east of Sault Ste. Marie. It is estimated that he had been dead for at least three years or more.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations in his lower teeth and evidence of tooth decay.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2021056657.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, skeletal remains were recovered from a lobster trap off the coast of Bay Roberts in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2020011470.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1988, at approximately 10:15am, Ian Lewis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ian had told his younger brother that he had wanted to go to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2018041450.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1999, Fakhri Daoud was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Fakhri had returned to his residence to gather some money, his passport, and some of his personal belongings. The day before, he had purchased a one-way flight ticket to Aman, Jordan.

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2007004799.CaseDesc: Stacy Dilenardi was last seen on November 28, 2005, purchasing some cigarettes at a gas bar in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (Garden River). He had just moved to Sault Ste. Marie and had recently started a job as a technician with the Ontario Forest Research Institute. Stacy had spoken to his father the day before his disappearance. On November 30, 2005, investigators located his vehicle north of the city on a snowmobile trail.
